dict.string: The human-readable description of this payload. This description appears on the Detail screen.
The human-readable name for the profile payload. The name appears on the Detail screen and doesn't need to be unique.

The reverse-DNS-style identifier for the payload. This identifier is usually the same as the TopLevel value, with an additional appended component. This string must be unique within the profile. During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The payload type, which each payload domain's reference page specifies.

The globally unique identifier for the payload. The actual content is unimportant, but must be globally unique. In macOS, use 'uuidgen' to generate UUIDs. During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The version of this specific payload.
The human-readable string containing the name of the organization that provides the profile. This value doesn't need to match the organization payload value in the enclosing dictionary.

array.dict:
pfm_allowed_file_types
public.plain-text
pfm_description If present, only AirPlay destinations in this list are available to the device. This allow list applies to supervised devices. <<<<<<< HEAD pfm_description_reference Optional. Supervised only (ignored otherwise). If present, only AirPlay destinations present in this list are available to the device. The dictionary format is described below. ======= >>>>>>> major_version_updates pfm_ios_min 14.5 pfm_macos_min 11.3 pfm_name AllowList pfm_subkeys
pfm_name AllowListItem pfm_require always pfm_subkeys
pfm_description <<<<<<< HEAD The device ID of the AirPlay destination in the format 'xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx'. This field isn't case-sensitive. ======= The device ID of the AirPlay destination in the format 'xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx'. This field isn't case-sensitive. The list of visible AirPlay destinations will be limited to devices that are present in the `AllowList` field of all installed AirPlay payloads. Specifying the same MACAddress more than once, whether in the same payload across different payloads, will result in undefined behavior. As of iOS 18 and macOS 15, `DeviceID` isn't supported, as tvOS 18 AirPlay destinations do not support it. >>>>>>> major_version_updates pfm_format ^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:){5}([0-9A-Fa-f]{2})$ pfm_ios_deprecated 18.0 pfm_macos_deprecated 15.0 pfm_name DeviceID pfm_title Device ID pfm_type string pfm_value_placeholder xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx
pfm_description The name of the AirPlay device. The list of visible AirPlay destinations will be limited to devices that are present in the AllowList field of all installed AirPlay payloads. pfm_ios_min 18.0 pfm_macos_min 15.0 pfm_name DeviceName pfm_title Device Name pfm_type string
pfm_supervised
pfm_title Allow List Content Item pfm_type dictionary pfmx_supported_oses
iOS
pfmx_introduced 7.0 pfmx_supervised
pfmx_user_enrollment
pfmx_mode forbidden
macOS
pfmx_introduced 10.10 pfmx_user_enrollment
pfmx_mode ignored
pfm_supervised
pfm_title Allow List pfm_type array pfm_value_import_processor lineValueForFormat pfmx_supported_oses
iOS
pfmx_introduced 14.5 pfmx_supervised
pfmx_user_enrollment
pfmx_mode forbidden
macOS
pfmx_introduced 11.3 pfmx_user_enrollment
pfmx_mode ignored

pfm_allowed_file_types
public.plain-text
pfm_description <<<<<<< HEAD Use 'AllowList' instead. As of macOS 11.3 and iOS 14.5 this key is deprecated. pfm_description_reference Optional. Supervised only (ignored otherwise). If present, only AirPlay destinations present in this list are available to the device. The dictionary format is described below. ======= Use 'AllowList' instead. This key is deprecated in iOS 14.5 and macOS 11.3. >>>>>>> major_version_updates pfm_ios_deprecated 14.5 pfm_macos_deprecated 11.3 pfm_name Whitelist pfm_subkeys
pfm_name AllowListItem pfm_require always pfm_subkeys
pfm_description <<<<<<< HEAD The AirPlay destination's MAC address ======= The device ID of the AirPlay destination in the format 'xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx'. This field isn't case-sensitive. The list of visible AirPlay destinations will be limited to devices that are present in the `AllowList` field of all installed AirPlay payloads. Specifying the same MACAddress more than once, whether in the same payload across different payloads, will result in undefined behavior. As of iOS 18 and macOS 15, `DeviceID` isn't supported, as tvOS 18 AirPlay destinations do not support it. >>>>>>> major_version_updates pfm_format ^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:){5}([0-9A-Fa-f]{2})$ pfm_ios_deprecated 18.0 pfm_macos_deprecated 15.0 pfm_name DeviceID pfm_title Device ID pfm_type string pfm_value_placeholder xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx
pfm_description The name of the AirPlay device. The list of visible AirPlay destinations will be limited to devices that are present in the AllowList field of all installed AirPlay payloads. pfm_ios_min 18.0 pfm_macos_min 15.0 pfm_name DeviceName pfm_title Device Name pfm_type string
pfm_supervised
pfm_title AllowList Content Item pfm_type dictionary
pfm_supervised
pfm_title Allow List (legacy) pfm_type array pfm_value_import_processor lineValueForFormat pfmx_supported_oses
iOS
pfmx_deprecated 14.5 pfmx_supervised
pfmx_user_enrollment
pfmx_mode forbidden
macOS
pfmx_deprecated 11.3 pfmx_user_enrollment
pfmx_mode ignored

pfm_description <<<<<<< HEAD If present, sets passwords for known AirPlay destinations. Using multiple entries for the same destination, whether within the same payload or across multiple installed payloads, is an error and results in undefined behavior. ======= If present, sets passwords for known AirPlay destinations. Using multiple entries for the same destination, whether within the same payload or across multiple installed payloads, is an error and results in undefined behavior. >>>>>>> major_version_updates pfm_name Passwords pfm_subkeys
pfm_description An item in the passwords pfm_name PasswordsItem pfm_require always pfm_subkeys
pfm_description <<<<<<< HEAD The AirPlay destination's name ======= The name of the AirPlay destination; used in iOS, and available in macOS 15 and later. pfm_macos_min 15.0 >>>>>>> major_version_updates pfm_name DeviceName pfm_require always pfm_title Device Name pfm_type string
pfm_description <<<<<<< HEAD The AirPlay destination's MAC address ======= The device ID of the AirPlay destination; used in macOS. In macOS 15 and later, 'DeviceID' is deprecated as tvOS 18 AirPlay destinations do not support it; use 'DeviceName' instead. >>>>>>> major_version_updates pfm_format ^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:){5}([0-9A-Fa-f]{2})$ pfm_macos_deprecated 15.0 pfm_name DeviceID pfm_platforms
macOS
pfm_require always pfm_title Device ID pfm_type string pfm_value_placeholder xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx
pfm_description <<<<<<< HEAD The password for the AirPlay destination ======= The password for the AirPlay destination. >>>>>>> major_version_updates pfm_name Password pfm_require always pfm_title Password pfm_type string
pfm_title Password Content Item pfm_type dictionary
pfm_title Passwords pfm_type array
